image.altText: Josh Hazlewood holds his arms in the in celebration while a despairing Ben Stokes keels over his bat

items.synopsis: Australia wins the second Test at Lord's, despite a masterful innings from England captain Ben Stokes taking his side within touching distance of another Ashes miracle.

title.children: Australia survives Stokes onslaught to win at Lord's as crowd accuses Aussies of cheating

image.altText: A screenshot showing Australian cricketers walking through the Lord's Long Room, with Usman Khawaja talking to a member.

items.synopsis: The final day of the second Ashes Test at Lord's is filled with drama thanks to Ben Stokes, a rarely seen stumping of Jonny Bairstow and "disappointing" abuse from the Lord's members. Here are five big moments from a dramatic finale.

title.children: Five quick hits — Bairstow's stumping against the 'spirit of the game' and Khawaja confronts Lord's members

image.altText: Ben Stokes and Pat Cummins are not looking at each other as they stand side by side

items.synopsis: Australia held its nerve to secure victory at Lord's and a 2-0 series lead, but that doesn't tell half the story of a day when the Ashes exploded into firey and controversial life.

title.children: Stokes stuns, Australia prevails but the Ashes just erupted into contentious, furious life

image.altText: Real estate agent puts up a sold sticker after this Mosman apartment sold at auction.

items.synopsis: Sydney, and particularly the most expensive areas within it, is leading a national house price rebound. But can it survive further interest rate rises and a possible recession?

title.children: The 'real danger' confronting property markets as house prices continue to rebound

image.altText: A burnt out white car on the back of a large tow truck on a French street.

items.synopsis: The grandmother of the teenager shot dead by police during a traffic stop in a Paris suburb says she wants the rioters to stop, as the home of a Paris suburb mayor is ram-raided and set alight.

title.children: Wife of French mayor undergoes surgery after fleeing from home rammed by car and set alight

image.altText: A woman sitting in a house.

items.synopsis: Apartments and townhouses make up nearly 30 per cent of homes in Australia, and some owners are feeling blindsided by strata fees which have climbed by up to 45 per cent in the past year.

title.children: 'I'll probably have to sell the place': Andrea felt blindsided when her strata fees went up by 45 per cent

image.altText: A composite of three people in front of a motorway and street signs.

items.synopsis: Millions of Australians face the daily frustration of delayed commutes, particularly on busy motorways. But as governments spend billions continually upgrading roads, experts say that might not be the best solution.

title.children: We keep adding lanes. But congestion seems to get worse

image.altText: A close-up shot of a woman holding a phone with a financial trading account on the screen.

items.synopsis: The federal government says Australians are facing a "scamdemic", with investment scams costing us over $1billion per year.

title.children: Government launches scam 'hit squad' in effort to curb more billions in losses

image.altText: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios walks with a bag on his bag as he passes a sign for 'The Championships' at Wimbledon.

items.synopsis: The tennis champion posts a message on social media announcing his withdrawal just hours after saying he was ready to play.

title.children: Nick Kyrgios withdraws from Wimbledon due to injury

image.altText: Laura wearing a grey jumper, holding her four-year-old daughter in her arms.

items.synopsis: The federal government is spending $5.4 billion to reduce the childcare costs of about 1.2 million families. But with high inflation and quirks in the system, there's concerns some parents won't see much savings.

title.children: 'A minefield': Why the childcare subsidy policy means some parents will get more than others

image.altText: A large piece of mining equipment, lit up in dawn light.

items.synopsis: A boom in the value of Australia's resources exports is coming to an end amid forecasts that earnings from iron ore, coal, and gas will fall.

title.children: Australia's half-trillion-dollar resources boom runs out of puff as exports decline

image.altText: a close-up of a person holding several pages of a household power bill in their hands

items.synopsis: In addition to the federal Energy Bill Relief Fund, many Australian states offer power rebates to certain households and small business.

title.children: Struggling with rising power costs? Here's a state-by-state breakdown of what government rebates and concessions are available

image.altText: Australian currency is seen next to a wages graph

items.synopsis: The good news includes a return to real wage growth and a restrained increase in unemployment. The bad news includes even higher home prices and a per-capita recession, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: The 'real danger' confronting property markets as house prices continue to rebound

image.altText: Police tape visible on the scene of a mass shooting incident in Baltimore.

items.synopsis: The Baltimore Police Department said two people have died, three are in a critical condition and 25 others have been injured.

title.children: More than a dozen children wounded in 'reckless, cowardly' mass shooting at Baltimore block party

image.altText: a globe with arrows pointing to Australia, and dollar signs on each one

items.synopsis: Going overseas used to be a reprieve from paying off your HECS-HELP loan, but that loophole has been closed since 2017. So how much has been recovered since?

title.children: HECS-pats: Australian grads abroad owe $1b in debt, and it's about to go up

image.altText: A man wearing handcuffs

items.synopsis: Four of Tasmania's worst offenders, including a man who subjected a teenager to a prolonged and brutal sexual attack, are set to have their indefinite prison sentences reviewed and may end up walking free.

title.children: 'Cruel legislation': Dangerous criminal tag review could result in freedom for rapists

image.altText: A young Indigenous man looks to the right of screen.

items.synopsis: Out on Barkindji country, Jareece embarks on a decades-long tradition. Walking through thick brush, he finds a nest of deep green-coloured eggs, soon to become a vessel for stories and knowledge.

title.children: Following emu tracks on red soil, Jareece finds a nest of eggs. Soon they'll hold generations of knowledge and stories

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: A river in Mount Isa floods a crossing, closing roads.

items.synopsis: The heavy falls come just a week after July heat records were broken across outback Queensland.

title.children: Mount Isa almost doubles its July rainfall record in 24 hours

image.altText: milk in a glass next to a milk carton

items.synopsis: The price of a bottle of milk is expected to rise as major dairy processors continue to pay farmers more for their milk.

title.children: Consumers warned the price of milk will rise, as processors lift their prices to dairy farmers

image.altText: An aerial view of catamarans and large whales in clear blue-green water with colourful 'Love the Philippines' logo.

items.synopsis: The ad agency apologises for using "foreign stock footage", describing it as an "unfortunate oversight on our agency's part".

title.children: Philippines tourism ad agency apologises for using stock footage from Switzerland, Brazil and UAE

image.altText: A woman at a police press conference.

items.synopsis: Queensland Police hope an emotional appeal from the family of murdered Gold Coast father-of-two Matthew Berry will lead to some vital information about his death.

title.children: Family of murdered Gold Coast father Matthew Berry issue emotional plea

image.altText: Woman stood smiling on a dirt road in the middle of a red dirt desert location.

items.synopsis: Some say sealing the Strzelecki Track will be "the end of an era". Many along the track see the benefits of laying bitumen but worry about the influx of travellers.

title.children: The Strzelecki Track 'can rattle you to pieces'. Heather Ewart learns the pros and cons of sealing the road

image.altText: A young girl smiles at bubbles blowing around the Come Together For Yes rally in Sydney

items.synopsis: Thousands take part in Yes vote events around the country as advocates lay out why Australia needs a Voice to Parliament.

title.children: 'We need to do this': Yes campaigners rally around the country

image.altText: A man in a black t-shirt stands in front of 6 microphones

items.synopsis: The man who beat Manny Pacquiao to take the WBO welterweight title in 2017 has taken up a new fight outside the ring.

title.children: Jeff Horn retires from the ring to focus on his 'biggest' fight yet

items.synopsis: If the whale is confirmed to be albino, it will be only the second confirmed case along Australia's east coast — and citizen scientists are urged to be on the lookout.

title.children: Drone photographer spots potential rare albino humpback whale calf

image.altText: A woman walks away from newspaper jobs in a rubbish bin

items.synopsis: According to some economists, we need more unemployment in Australia to get inflation under control. But, Gareth Hutchens asks, do they know how jobseekers are treated?

title.children: Economists want more unemployment. But do they care how the jobless will be treated?

image.altText: A group of dejected-looking Melbourne AFL players walk with hands on hips after losing a game.

items.synopsis: The top four remains open as Melbourne drops four points to GWS in Alice Springs, while West Coast falls just short of an incredible upset against St Kilda and the Blues take care of the Hawks at the MCG.

title.children: Top-four spot wide open after Giants stun Demons, Saints pip Eagles

image.altText: Several retail fireworks placed in front of a cardboard box.

items.synopsis: Authorities say two men were taken to hospital after the incident, which unfolded at an address in the Darwin rural area.

title.children: Darwin man loses hand in fireworks-related incident as firefighters respond to nearly 100 blazes

image.altText: Medical staff in hazmat suits carry patient in a clear container

items.synopsis: Highly trained doctors and nurses at the facility in Sydney's west will provide care to those with diseases so dangerous they're likely to kill more than half of those that contract them.

title.children: 'Prepared for worst': Inside Australia's new line of defence against next deadly disease outbreak

image.altText: Street signs mark the intersection of Constance and Ann streets in Brisbane's Fortitude Valley

items.synopsis: Queensland Police are appealing for witnesses after a gang of men wearing masks and balaclavas allegedly attacked patrons leaving venues in Fortitude Valley on Saturday night.

title.children: Masked men wanted after spate of late-night knife attacks in Brisbane

image.altText: Volunteers setting up a laser imager to scan the All Saints Church in Kyiv.

items.synopsis: Historical sites have become another type of battlefield in Russia's war, as volunteers battle to preserve Ukrainian identity for future generations.

title.children: The volunteers striving to save Ukraine's history amid war
